page.title: 03THE SPITTLES - LYME REGIS
page.content: The Spittles lies North East of the town. It is a national trust walk and is popular with tourists. There are many forms of wildlife, in the four areas which are the copse, fields, cliffs and undergrowth. Rabbits, badgers, foxes and snakes are the most common. There are interesting plants in the undergrowth like wild strawberries and a lot of fungi. The soil is clay and the clay cliffs move nearer the sea every year. The view from the cliffs is amazing. You can see the whole of Lyme Bay and Portland. On clear days you can see right down to Brixham.
